title: Fish Tacos with Creamy Lime Guacamole and Cabbage Slaw
summary: The recipe Fish Tacos with Creamy Lime Guacamole and Cabbage Slaw could satisfy your Mexican craving in roughly 45 minutes. For $2.17 per serving, this recipe covers 21% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. One portion of this dish contains roughly 24g of protein, 13g of fat, and a total of 332 calories. This recipe serves 10. This recipe from My Recipes has 1 fans. It is perfect for The Fourth Of July. Not a lot of people really liked this main course. It is a good option if you're following a pescatarian diet. Head to the store and pick up snapper fillets, lime juice, hass avocadoshalved, and a few other things to make it today. To use up the lime juice you could follow this main course with the Lime Angel Food Cake with Lime Glaze and Pistachios as a dessert. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 76%. This score is solid. Similar recipes include Spicy Fish Tacos with Cabbage Slaw + Lime Crema, Fish Tacos with Creamy Chipotle Cabbage Slaw, and Grilled Chili-Lime Fish Tacos with Sour Cream Cabbage Slaw + Mango & Avocado.

winePairing.pairingText: Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir are my top picks for Fish. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Grüner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. The Zind-Humbrecht Clos Windsbuhl Vendange Tardive Pinot Gris with a 5 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 99 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Zind-Humbrecht Clos Windsbuhl Vendange Tardive Pinot Gris

instructions: Light a grill. In a medium bowl, mash the avocados, sour cream, jalapeo, red onion, cilantro and 3 tablespoons of the lime juice. Season the guacamole with salt and pepper and press a piece of plastic wrap directly onto the surface of the guacamole.                                                                                                In a large bowl, toss the cabbage with the 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil and the remaining 2 tablespoons of lime juice. Season with salt and pepper.                                                                                                Brush the fish with oil and season with salt and pepper. Grill over moderately high heat until lightly charred and cooked through, about 10 minutes. Transfer the fish to a platter and pull off the skin.                                                                                                To assemble each taco, spread a dollop of guacamole on a tortilla. Top with a piece of fish, a few tomato slices and a large spoonful of the cabbage slaw. Serve with the hot sauce and lime wedges.

steps.step: Light a grill. In a medium bowl, mash the avocados, sour cream, jalapeo, red onion, cilantro and 3 tablespoons of the lime juice. Season the guacamole with salt and pepper and press a piece of plastic wrap directly onto the surface of the guacamole.
In a large bowl, toss the cabbage with the 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil and the remaining 2 tablespoons of lime juice. Season with salt and pepper.
Brush the fish with oil and season with salt and pepper. Grill over moderately high heat until lightly charred and cooked through, about 10 minutes.
Transfer the fish to a platter and pull off the skin.
To assemble each taco, spread a dollop of guacamole on a tortilla. Top with a piece of fish, a few tomato slices and a large spoonful of the cabbage slaw.
Serve with the hot sauce and lime wedges.
